analysis: The documents relate to orders and directives issued by the US government, primarily during and after the Civil War. They cover a range of topics including military commissions, troop deployments, acknowledgements of service, responses to potential insurrections, expressions of gratitude to military personnel, limitations on military authority in civilian affairs, commendations for military achievements, assignments of military command, and the transfer of property to the Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands. The sentiment is generally formal and authoritative, reflecting the official nature of the documents.
title: Civil War Era Military and Reconstruction Directives
